lead_paragraph: Anna Hazare threatens to go on an anti-Congress poll campaign, if his version of the Lokpal Bill is not passed in the winter session of the Parliament. Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab and Manipur are slated for assembly polls next year. Mr. Hazare demanded a written commitment from the Congress Party on the issue before Thursday's holiday of Dussehra. (Hindustan Times)Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and Afghanistan President Hamid Karzai signed their first-ever strategic partnership agreement on Tuesday in New Delhi. India has agreed to train the Afghan national security forces, and the two countries pledged trade and economic cooperation, from developing trade routes to exploring for minerals and hydrocarbons in Afghanistan. (The Hindu)

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Wednesday
